website_summaries.verdict: Has plenty of extra features to make it a valuable accessory when camping.
pros: Allows you to charge the unit with solar panels or a hand crank for the 2,000 mAh power bank
Can access FM, AM, and NOAA weather radio signals
cons: Hand crank doesn't deliver much power

website_summaries.verdict: Multiple options for keeping this versatile radio fully powered and ready to work.
pros: Has weather and emergency radio reception capability
Radio can be powered by solar panel, hand crank, batteries, USB, or AC/DC
Includes antenna to pull in distant signals
cons: Hand crank and solar panel only provide electrical power for a few minutes

customer_reviews.title: NOAA Alert does not work
customer_reviews.text: A key feature for an emergency radio is when there is a NOAA alert, the radio will inform you of that alert. According the the instructions "Set the band selector to Weather and turn the weather band to your local weather station. Then set the power selector to NOAA Alert and the Voyager will go on automatically when there is an alert from the National Weather Service." Unfortunately, after I purchased this radio, there was a local NOAA Alert and the radio did not go on. If this feature is important to you, do not purchase this radio.
customer_reviews.author: T. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing. Have had it for couple of months ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Have had it for couple of months. Switches itself off randomly. Recent power failure in the area: radio performance: solar: Works in direct sunlight only. Cloud cover unit shuts off immediately. Hand crank: it works as long as you're cranking, you stop cranking, it stops working..right now! Adjust the station finder with your teeth while cranking. It will be part of the landfill next week
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this radio. Solar cells don't charge unless in direct sunlight. When you plug the wall adapter in it, it cuts out all stations. Very poor reception, Only super weak short wave signals, maybe one AM station and a couple FM stations. I'd return it but it was a low cost radio and not worth my effort so its in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Watson

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, non functional cr@p.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cheaply made. Selector switches are flimsy and glitchy. FM works sometimes not others. Battery will not hold a charge. This is a toy that Mattel would have made better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Szuri

customer_reviews.title: Essential for emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when I heard hurricane Harvey was coming towards the Texas coast. I live in Houston and wanted to be prepared. We lost power a few times and this made that time so much better. We were able to keep in communication with our family because the radio charges our phone, had entertainment with the radio and a lantern so we weren't sitting in the dark! I looked at a few different models and decided on this one because to all of the features. I'm so glad I did. My husband is even happy about it, even though he thought I was going overboard buying it. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Solid little radio, perfect for garage & emergency use
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I'm not giving 4 stars is the not so intuitive operation, exarcebated by a poorly (grammatically challenged) written manual. But once I got my self sorted out, the radio operates great fro what I want it: a radio I can use while working in the garage that will double as an emergency radio when, well, hopefully never, but we still have to be ready. I got it with the AC/DC adapter, and I recommend you do likewise. Really, it should come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Suastegui

customer_reviews.title: VOYAGER 500L WARNING -- NO AC adapter socket.
customer_reviews.text: VOYAGER 500L WARNING -- AC Adapter (Kaito AD500 AC Adapter for Kaito Voyager Series) that is advertised with this product, the Voyager 500L version at least, does NOT work with the 500L. The 500L has a Lithium battery and no socket for the AC adapter. Additionally, the plastic case of the radio obstructs the USB "IN" port used for charging even using the USB cord provided. You can plug it in, and sometimes it holds but is NOT fully seated. Hard to believe that they didn't even try the USB "IN" port. The user manual is a toy and lacks much the information desired and the translation from Chinese to English is at best poor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W. Kirschner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, swiss army knife of radios
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and well packaged. I was very happy with all of the functions including a bright light, different radio bands (AM/FM/NOAA and others) and also pleased to see how well it worked after just a minute of cranking the handle. I would highly recommend everyone have one whether you are prepping for hurricanes/blizzards/tornadoes or the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Randy T.

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming quality
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the packaging, the radio tuning faceplate fell out of place and onto the ground. Then I noticed the tuning sticker was misaligned. Having a radio in case of a blackout or emergency is a good idea, but the quality of construction seems poor. It does play music and seems to function under normal conditions, but I don't have much confidence that this thing could handle bad weather or a rough drop. And if you're in conditions where batteries are unavailable and you need to use the crank or solar panel, I wouldn't expect it to really hold up. Probably a good pick to keep in your car or for some light camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Features, But No Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio has lots of really terrific features - four different power sources, flashlight, reading light. But if need a radio, keep looking. I got two FM stations, no AM stations, no weather stations, no short wave reception. But the flashlight works reasonably well. So if you need a low light flashlight with multiple power sources, this might be just your item - a $50 flashlight. But if you want a radio, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Radio for Emergencies or Power Outages
customer_reviews.text: Just received this. So far, it seems like a nifty little radio. It came partially charged, I left it in the sun for a couple of hours & when I came back the battery light indicated a full charge. Reception is good, speaker quality is...okay. Certainly good enough (or a lifesaver) in an emergency. It does everything it promises. It's not as 'rugged' as it looks, so don't drop it or leave it out in the weather. This is great to keep on-hand for an emergency, or if you lose power -- which is why I bought it. So far I love it, a great radio for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Lost in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed....
customer_reviews.text: At first, this looked like a nice setup. AM/FM/SW and NOAA... I tried, and really tried to get some SW stations. Nothing! After reading the reviews, I thought it'd be much more than what this unit actually is. Being advertised as a radio that could cover all of these types of broadcasts sounded so good... maybe too good to be true for the price point.... I'm probably going to return it... but I'm at a loss of what to get as a replacement. I'd like something that provides good reception for AM/FM/SW and NOAA... what's out there???
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: The Good: This radio receives FM and weather signals better than I expected. I like the lights and the variety of power options. The Bad: AM and SW reception is below average compared to radios I've had in the past. The radio looks and feels cheep, it's also smaller than I expected. I'm afraid to turn the crank much as the plastic handle is so thin I fear it might break. This radio should've been about $20.00 cheaper IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: ofenmann

customer_reviews.title: As promoted
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little radio with a lot of functionality that could be helpful in an emergency I tested all of its functionality and everything worked. Some items like the charging via the crank and via the sun are slow and time consuming but they work and may be essential in an emergency. Despite buying this device for my "emergency needs" I have found it a helpful little radio to use in the yard and other places where a portable radio comes in handy. Sound quality is OK for a small relatively inexpensive radio.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this item was a great problem solver for our needs but was sorely disappointed. After about 2-3 weeks of use it stopped getting radio signal well no matter how you charged it. Now the only way it works is if you put in regular batteries which entirely defeats the purpose...
customer_reviews.author: Meggin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a replacement on the old one I had that died during hurricane Irma (of course!) This is easy to set up & use, live in Florida so we get our weekly NOAA tests on Wednesdays (am & pm) it is loud! Very reasonably priced, it will definitely work for emergency's which is why I have this, tornado warnings, strong storms etc. Nice to have warnings in advance so we can take cover.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: pleased as punch over this thing
customer_reviews.text: wow! what a radio. love it. in this day and age of ear phone, i-pad, cell phone music, it is unusual to get excited about a portable radio but this radio has it all. i plan on using my radio in the country for weather and baseball games. don't forget to buy the a/c adaptor - very handy. this is truly a camper's rsdio or weekender's. this will not replace a good stereo but it's portable and it gets noaa.tuner light is a great option, especially when dealing with fm. this radio is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: uncle ralphie

customer_reviews.title: Barely used this radio - Battery and Solar Panel very poor.
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted this radio for Christmas 2018. I checked it out a little bit. It worked as far as I tested it. I've recently tried to use it while working in the garage. The wind up aspect of the radio either doesn't charge the internal battery, or the battery itself is not capable of holding a charge. When outside in bright sun, the solar panel doesn't give the radio enough power to work. I'm very disappointed. If you purchased this radio, you better test it thoroughly. Perhaps I have a lemon. Perhaps it's a very poorly made product. Don't be caught in an emergency and go for this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisp

customer_reviews.title: You don't need it until you do, but when you do, it's the best tool in the emergency kit.
customer_reviews.text: No sooner did I buy one, there was a fire storm in my county, 190,000 evacuated, along with that, PG&E shut of the power in multiple counties for 4 days. This little radio sat in the sun on a window sill and kept delivering vital information by radio. I have sense used it outside while doing chores. I wish it could charge by solar fast enough to play and charge. When the battery is low, it doesn't work in the shade. Still, there are alternate ways to charge, so it does everything you need it to in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery last 5 minutes and the solar power doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Well after a few months the battery life has now gone from a good while to about 5 minutes. The bigger issue is the solar power no longer functions it was very weak to begin with but now it completely does not work the only way now that This emergency radio can work is if I have access to a power source such as electricity which kind and neutralizes the whole use in an emergency radio
customer_reviews.author: Kleal

customer_reviews.title: Super Weather Radio!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this Voyager 4-Way Powered Weather Radio. After recently going through fires/flooding in Carpinteria,CA, I wanted to ensure I had a way to keep informed of the weather by radio (NOAA) in the future. Voyager is nice looking and is compact with weather bands, AM/FM stations and can be charged by solar, crank, battery or DC adapter optional). Earphones and UCB cord provided for listening and charging my IPhone/iPad. Includes easy to understand instructions. A lot of clear radio stations and several weather bands giving current weather reports. Antenna, reading lights and flashlight with SOS setting a plus. Thank you Kaito for designing such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sara E. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, user-friendly, excellent design! Great CS too!
customer_reviews.text: After a power-outage at home with a hand-crank flashlight, but no radio and no option to charge cell-phone, I realized the importance of emergency preparedness. The Kaito KA500 radio covers so many bases, in such a small nice portable package, they could easily charge $20 to $30 more for this GEM. I plan to use this outdoors, at the pool, camping, etc. Handcrank + solar enough - not even going to add 3 AA batteries. Further, customer support EXCELLENT, thorough, and fast. Thanks, George, Kaito, and all!
customer_reviews.author: Jamin Roth

customer_reviews.title: Bad NOAA Reception & Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you read the return policy before purchasing this item. Our mistake was, we didn't. The reason we returned this item was because of the poor reception from the NOAA station. I'm not sure if it has to do with us being in Hawaii (specifically Kaneohe). The other stations, (92.3, 98.5, etc), came in very clearly. The seller deducted $13.00 for two way shipping. We've returned other items for simply not liking it, which is why we love Amazon. We will definitely be reading shipping policies more carefully in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kaneohe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this earlier in the year after the California earthquakes to put in my emergency kit. I take it everywhere and on vacations with me. For the past couple months it’s lived in the trunk of my car. I took it out to use it today and it’s still completely charged. It’s a bit beat up from being in my trunk but it’s held up amazingly for being thrown around with a softball, softball bat, and all the other things in my trunk. I’m sure it’ll survive an apocalypse. I haven’t played around with the weather band or any of the emergency things but the regular radio and the lights work fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: penguinio

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor (or Hurricane) ordered!
customer_reviews.text: We added the KA500 to our ever-expanding list of supplies for Florida hurricane prep. The reception is excellent. I tried FM, local AM and weather band stations. All were clear and crackle-free. I was especially impressed with the range of plugs. In an emergency you need back-ups for the back-ups, and the KA500 has it. USB, (AND mini-USB), antenna port, AA's and rechargeable, then hand-crank and solar. The solar is slow, but that's expected. It was brilliant to make the solar array tilt so you don't have to lay it down on a log or something to charge at the correct angle. Well done y'all!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio, Great Reception, Great Price, With Numerous Power Options!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the negative reviews are all about. This is well made, has great reception (yes, even short wave and weather) and has numerous power options. It can be charged with a USB cable and charging port obviating the need for an AC cord. The crank does work but undoubtedly will only give you a half hour, or less of operation. If you're hunkering down in your shelter you would wisely have included a number of AA batteries with long shelf life. It does everything it advertises and it does it all quite well. Very satisfied to pay only $50 for a radio I really don't expect to use except in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency radio.
customer_reviews.text: Received the radio yesterday and have gone through each of the features of the emergency radio and all work perfectly. The radio has a rubber type protective covering which also makes for a good gripping surface. The hand crank works very smooth and feels durable. The compact size in no way diminishes the features or performance of this radio. The ability to also use AA batteries in addition to the rechargeable battery pack adds to the usefulness of the radio. To be able to also put a charge to a smartphone is another strong point. At this time I would highly recommend this radio for part of anyone's emergency preparadness.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Investment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio many months ago and stuck it in the basement, almost forgetting about it. Last night we had a tornado warning (unusual for this part of the country) and my wife and I headed for the basement. Just before losing power, I saw the radio, removed it from the box and fired it up. It worked perfectly. We were able to hear the NOAA reports as well as weather from our local stations. This radio was a very good investment for us.
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this product. It feels good quality, everything works, nothing feels cheap. I live in a city so my reception is perfect without having the antenna up. The lights aren't 1,000 lumens but they will light up the room and allow you to see the tuning bars. I used it to charge my phone so that feature works excellently. If you're looking for the NOAA radio, light, solar crank combo thats popular then I would recommend this brand. I wasn't able to get very many broadcasts on the SW but I was just using the standard antenna. Kaito makes a cable that will boost your reception if you're interested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 day.
customer_reviews.text: Received item, connected rechargeable battery, placed standard fresh AA batteries in unit. Selected the Battery mode and unit worked as expected for 1/2 to 1 day. Unit would no longer function on standard batteries when battery mode was selected. Swapped with fresh batteries, verified orientation, still would not function on standard battery mode. Have requested an exchange via Amazon - will try a replacement unit. Received exchange and it has worked well. Revising my review from 1 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: networkadminman

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional dependability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for better access to local wildfire threats here in Ventura. Clear reception for all news am channel needed for evacuation orders. The electric power and internet are not reliable here during fire/mudflow/earthquake events and are down for long periods of time. Have not tried the shortwave channels yet. Weather band clear. Lights are great for night time power outages. Yellow case easy to see in low light conditions. Fully meets my expectations. Recommed bump up price if needed and include the AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This radio has clearly marked dials - something I think is very important for a radio designed for use in an emergency. I think if the lights are out, it will be important to be able to operate the radio without a lot of confusing buttons or dials. I like that it can be charged in multiple ways and that it can be left on standby for NOAA emergency announcements. I like the bright yellow color too, easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: eileen-s

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do the NOAA alert which was the whole point.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little radio while it lasted, for a whole year or so before the NOAA alert stopped working. I've had it 2 years and 3 months now. I do like using it to listen to FM and weather radio, but it does not alert. I had 6 different storm, flood and tornado alerts today and this radio just sat there. The power is working. It still charges. I have looked online for a fix and have read the owners manual several times. It is set to the correct channels. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money on this radio.
customer_reviews.author: SilentE8

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This radio has all the features you need in an emergency or just a power failure. You never need to worry about running out of batteries. Just turn the crank for a few minutes and you have the power needed for the radio, flashlight, reading light, and emergency flashing red light. An added feature is the fact that you also use the sun to power the solar cells to run the radio. You can also charge your smart phone with it. The radio can pick up NOAA weather channels, two short wave channels as well as AM & FM stations. The radio arrived as scheduled. I will definitely use this seller again,
customer_reviews.author: Salty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in a plastic bag damaged packaging. I waited until we had a hurricane to try it and now it's too late to return it. The quality is very poor (cheap Chinese junk) during 2 days of hurricane it did not produce any weather alerts JUST ANNOYING STATIC.
customer_reviews.author: Dinka

customer_reviews.title: Music While You
customer_reviews.text: I fish a lot so for relaxing and calling the fish I play my portable VOYAGER KA500. Seriously speaking the voyager does not take up much room and it charges itself with the SOLAR panels as I relax to an evening of fishing. I recommend the Voyager KA 500 to anyone that loves to fish camp or listen to music. Great Buy! Freddie the fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: freddie adkins

customer_reviews.title: Kaito Radio
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell. I Just got it and it feels like a cheap piece of plastic. Dials feel like they are going to break when changing them. The dial markings are so small I need a magnifying glass to see what setting it's on. I wear glasses that are bi focal but even looking through the reading lens I can't see it. Anyway this radio is like every thing else nowadays. Quality is just a thing of the past.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I like this!
customer_reviews.text: This radio is a good value. It meets all of my expectations and more. The receiver works well on all bands, especially the NOAA band. Bought this for those times when the power goes out here on the island, and also for backpacking. The solar and hand crank charging works well, contrary to some reviews I have read. Yes, it can take awhile to charge using these methods, however the solar panel meets my expectations given it's size. The complaints about the hand crank also seem to me to be unreasonable. It's a portable radio not a model T engine. Time will tell if this radio will last, but I think it will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for emergency use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this NOAA emergency radio...Kaito KA500. Didn't get the slightest charge from the hand crank. The included batteries didn't work. No charge from solar exposure after a day being in direct sunlight. Only way it worked was with the 3 AA batteries that I installed. Radio signal weak, lots of static. The flashlight and flashing red light did work. Just really unhappy because I had read good reviews from independent sources.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Breeland

customer_reviews.title: great radio but should come with charger and antenna
customer_reviews.text: This could be one of my favorite emergency radios. We are very outdoorsy and own several. I am disappointed that the short wave antenna is not included, and sold separately.Also does not come with the Charger (sold separately) I believe for the money paid these should have been part of the package. I like that you have the option to change weather stations, which is important if you will be traveling. It Has an LED flashlight, which. Could have been much brighter. And SOS light is miniature. I would like to see a bigger SOS Light with the option of a screamin horn. Solar panel works great. Lights behind panel are good to light area. A/M F/M have good reception.
customer_reviews.author: OmahaGreen

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the blue one - nice design, and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today, so cannot state how long it will last, but love the look and the features. I followed the instructions and plugged in the rechargeable battery pack, and cracked it for a minute, and it works just fine. AM radio came in loud and clear even without the antenna being extended. The lights are nice, and it seems like a great little emergency radio/charger/light.
customer_reviews.author: Always Looking for the TruthTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Everything we need and more!
customer_reviews.text: We spend a great deal of time camping and hiking. We love the fact the Voyager KA500 is lightweight and will provide us with the services of NOAA radio as we often in areas of high wind or potential tornadoes and need to know where the weather is and if we are in any danger. The self-powered Crank Power is a fantastic feature and we never have to worry about our cell phones dying with the USB port on the radio. Includes a flashlight on the radio as well as LED reading lamp and SOS Emergency Light. In our opinion this is a unit every hiker and camper should own!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Lost power in a storm and used this little radio to listen to a hockey game "I couldn't miss". Sound quality was good, tuner dial worked well and was able to find the station and even adjust just slightly to get an even better transmission. I used the hand-crank and turned it about 40 times, and the radio lasted for the whole game without having to turn the hand-crank again. I was impressed. I was glad to test this emergency radio out in a 'non-emergency' setting and know it works, and should perform should I every truly need it in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: CPS

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I just love this little solar radio. It sits in a windowsill and is always charged and ready to go thanks to the design that lets you lift the solar panel at an angle rather than being "glued" to the side. Have not had to use the crank so I don't know how good it is (they usually fail rather quickly). I mainly use it for the weather channel when the power goes out (which is fairly often).
customer_reviews.author: skeptigal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worked well when I first got it. But I think they precharged the battery pack before shipping it to me. I was expecting more for the money I spent on this. Not happy. Pros - Works well if your gonna have it plugged into a outlet or using AA batteries. Cons - Solar panel doesn't work well. So you have to constantly hand crank this. Five minutes of cranking only gives you 5 to 20 mins of use. Radio signal goes out alot if your standing to close to it. Certain battery brands wont fit in back of radio. The Hand crank is too small and akwkard for the constant cranking you have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Moon

customer_reviews.title: Safe with sound
customer_reviews.text: The hurricane in Houston, and impending Hurricane Irma is making me feel very uneasy. Decided it was time to invest in a hand-crank radio. Ordered the KA500 tested it today. It's a great little unit. Feel much more prepared to protect my family during an emergency. If not this time around...then certainly at some point in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first radio because the 6 cell phone tips were not included in the box as clearly advertised that it did come with them. "It also comes with 6 cellphone tips that can charge many model phones by cranking or solar power. " I repurchased another one and it still did not come with the 6 cell phone tips. False advertising for a product.
customer_reviews.author: Brunswick O.

customer_reviews.title: It powers by batteries. - Solar. - Crank charge by Nimh batteries
customer_reviews.text: I needed an emergency radio for some of my area, which loses power sometimes. I live in a low valley area but the radio picked Up the weather bands clear and loud. I just cranked it a couple of times and it gave me immediate power. The 2 shortwave stations also pulled in some rations. Also for the money it has a usb to charge your iPod or iPhone - An emergency red flashing light And mini flashlight. Also charges by solar. Definitely worth the 49.00 I paid for it. Valuable part of your emergency equipment. Ken
customer_reviews.author: R. Kacey

customer_reviews.title: Great radio for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the little radio and use it a lot. The only thing, the seller promises sending you an electrical adapter or a short wave antenna if you give it a good review. Thats the reason it has so many great reviews. Good luck ever getting it. I have called and they always say they will send it but they never do.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: This device does everything I want it to do.
customer_reviews.text: This device has everything I wanted. Includes rechargeable and regular batteries, solar and crank power, ability to charge phone, light, NOAA alarms and continuous reporting and radio stations (great to use when hurricane over and power is out to have music). I tried everything upon receipt and so far so good! The big test will come with our first hurricane and extensive use but it should be fine. Our area was notified a couple weeks ago of an increase in the number of hurricanes expected in our area for this year vs. the original forecast for this year.
customer_reviews.author: D. Murrells

customer_reviews.title: Good item, should have come with the adapter
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I feel that this radio should have come with the AC adapter already. $15 extra bucks or so and not even close to that much if Kaito buys in bulk. Should be in there. We use this type of radio for weather as part of the safety plan to make sure all areas are informed of tornadoes and other severe weather alerts. The caveat to my gripe is that many radios do not even give you the option for AC charging and some that have the port for the adapter do not let you run the radio and charge at the same time. Read the details on each one, there seems to be no real standard.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fine Little Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: I've had the chance to test this Kaito Voyager radio over the last couple of days. I dont understand why all the bad reviews...This radio performs very well, the rechargeable batteries work very well and are easy to recharge. All channels work very well with no problems. Shortwave worked very well, there was channel drift but that is due to atmospheric conditions...I purchased a shortwave antenna to give the signal a boost, work very well. Nice cheap emergency radio I would buy again...highly recommend. I am able to recieve 3 weather channels..
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Felix/ John Pytel

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice NOAA weather radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice NOAA weather radio, but I returned it because it does NOT have a way to use AA batteries as advertised. I wanted it because of that particular feature. Evidently the earlier models used to have a way to use batteries, and the company did not change the Amazon ad.
customer_reviews.author: TheBreeze

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any experience with similar products so I cannot make a comparison but everything about this emergency tool is above standard. The sturdy construction protects it from the dings and slings of fortune. It's handy: easy to set up and carry. It comes with good directions, which is a plus these days. It has so many features--lights, USB (both mini and standard) that the engineering stands out: buttons, lights, tuners etc. all easy to find and use: NOT like the confusing layout of other products with so many features. Radio quality is better than I'm getting through my Yamaha sound system. Price is amazing for all that's packed in here.
customer_reviews.author: Yes Yes MM

customer_reviews.title: cheap as hell and seller kept $14 in shipping costs when i returned this toy
customer_reviews.text: headline says it all.... not worth $45, maybe $25 for one time use.... piece of crap that i returned as i couldn't trust it in case of emergency and they kept $14 for shipping so beware
customer_reviews.author: John J. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built, function and form are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just received our Kaito Emergency radio and cannot be more pleased. Functions are efficient and easy to use. Form makes sense. Instructions are straightforward. Seems well built! In Hawai'i we are in the midst of hurricane season. At the start of our first major threat I learned that a not-so-old radio purchased a few seasons ago stopped working. Was very disappointed, and after some research came across this Kaito radio. Glad it came in time for our next storm on the way! AND most importantly they value the input of their customers by providing a special offer - in exchange of honest review they will send your choice of a free accessory (there are two to choose from). Mahalo nui.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa P.

customer_reviews.title: Good emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: I just received this radio so I can only give my first impressions. It has good reception and sound quality for it's size. Tune it until you get the tuning light to come on if possible so sound is crystal clear. I like all the options to charge it. It took a few minutes of cranking to get the high battery light to come on. I wish there was a light to show it was fully charged. Other than that, I think it's a good radio and will come in handy during a weather emergency or camping. I will update my review in the future if I have any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel Bella

customer_reviews.title: Drained the battery instead of charging it!
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. added new batteries, cranked it up and "charged" my cell phone which was at 46%. Within minutes it was at 25% and it proceeded to drain to zero. I tried again, this time using a recommended wall adapter. Same story. Immediately discharged the phone. In both cases, the "lightning bolt" superimposed on the battery icon on the toolbar showed that the unit was "charging" while it was, in fact, draining the battery. Stay away from this device!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Worried about power outages in California and no generator. I live in a rural area with traditionally poor signal. But the radio worked well. I used it with AA batteries. I also tried it using the crank and it worked. However, the crank seems rather flimsy and fragile. I will lay in a supply of batteries. All in all it is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: MARDI M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible radio defective
customer_reviews.text: Very very disappointed with this radio. I waited almost 2 weeks for this to come in because it was back ordered and when I received it the charging port isn’t working. That’s the main reason I bought it!!! This radio is just way to pricey for what it is. Terrible radio the people at kaito should test every radio for accuracy and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Callingyou

customer_reviews.title: Unbiased, Incentivized Review of a Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: The seller has promised to send me a free plug-in power adapter if I write a review on this product. Actually, I would write it even without that incentive! The amazing number of features on this emergency radio is staggering, and I can't think of a single addition to make. We are involved in helping homeless people in our community, and those forced to sleep under the stars (or bridges!) could really use one of these beauties, for weather alerts, charging their phones, keeping up with the news, and listening to music. We're hoping that it is as durable as it looks! We plan to send these as Christmas presents to family members this year!
customer_reviews.author: LCH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to change the battery
customer_reviews.text: After my old radio was destroyed in Hurricane Irma, I purchased this radio. My old radio was similar- it could be powered with a handcrank, solar panel or through a "rechargeable" battery. The only problem is that the rechargeable battery doesn't have an unlimited lifespan, and when I tried to change the battery, I broke the plug port for the battery. This radio is awesome- I can change the battery with no problem, it even runs on 3 AA batteries if the rechargeable battery dies. I've tried out the crank and solar panel and they work very well. Hopefully I won't need to use it, but I'm very happy to have it, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Scarolina

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don’t fit
customer_reviews.text: The AA batteries don’t fit. The slot where the two batteries fit end to end is not long enough! I had several people and they came to the same conclusion. Has anyone else had this same problem?
customer_reviews.author: lori anne cahill

customer_reviews.title: Buy this radio its worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Have to say this product was definitely worth the money. Unboxed it plugged in the supplied rechargeable batteries and it came alive. Sound clarity is really good and loud for such a little radio was able to pick up a few sw1 and sw2 stations as well with the stock antenna. So far I see no flaws with this radio it would be a good investment for an emergency radio and bug out kit or just casual listening in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie P.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable peace of mind in emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this AFTER a four day power outage which guarantees it won't be needed until next year. But when it happens again I'm set. This device is sturdy and well designed. It gives me the peace of mind that when the lights do go out I'll have this multi tasking device charged and ready to go. This replaces a similar older combo radio that had half of the options of the Voyager. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sheba

customer_reviews.title: very satisfactory emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Great color - easy to find in the debris of a collapsed house. Dynamo charging worked well, though charging a phone from this battery would take a loooong time FM reception was very good - brought in stations I didn't think we could get in our valley Liked the NOAA channels - makes it simple to find information in the stress of an emergency. Will keep a set of Lithium batteries in this (costly, but longer storage life and more power). Not sure how to ensure we check this (annually?) to ensure its working and the batteries are OK. That will require discipline!
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Chatwin

customer_reviews.title: Every emergency kit needs one
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for our emergency at home kit. Seems to operate as advertised and needed. A bunch of great features packed into a small radio. Solar panel seems like the cheapest part. But as long as it does the job. We also have a 2500 watt generator so not really looking at this as a charging source.
customer_reviews.author: ElecEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I purchased this radio
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased this radio. I live out in the sticks and I was pleased to HEAR the reception was clean and on point. I now have radio in my bug out bag. The other cool thing it it has multiple ways to power it and comes with rechargeable battery right off the start..I would recommend this to anyone that's in a danger zone of flood, fire, earthquake. And read the instructions and plug the rechargeable battery in, in the battery compartment. Peace out!
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hurricane survivors
customer_reviews.text: Radio is sturdy, and has five ways to charge it. Delivery was fast and well packaged. I recommend this radio for anyone in a hurricane prone area. When the power goes out and you can't even get tv or internet due to cable, it's a reliable source for news and entertainment. When the power goes out, you're bored, it's sweltering hot, everything is closed and there is the stench of rotting food, you really appreciate a self charging radio! Quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Fl Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for newscasts, information but....
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and construction of this radio, not too unwieldy but big enough to provide decent sound and house a bunch of useful tools like a USB port, lights and solar panel. My only complaint is that it didn't include a charger...you have to pay $15 to order one, or write a review to get one for free. That's pretty coercive. The radio is good, but there are lots of good choices out there, and if I was doing this again I would buy a radio that included the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Marantos

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the product for long, but right off the bat the accessories and knobs appear well manufactured and sturdy. I honestly expected the battery from the hand crank to only last a few minutes (to get your emergency alerts) but it keeps going and going... I think this more than adequate for emergency uses. Hope to never have to find out ;)
customer_reviews.author: MA1981

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any kit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little, lightweight radio that I enjoy having in my kit. The solar charging has worked great for me and during a week of rain while camping, I did not have to change the batteries at all with almost continual use. I played with the dynamo a bit and found that it will work fine if I require it. The emergency weather bands came in very clear even in the mountains where FM reception was crap. Overall I like it. I carry it in the truck with my emergency kit and I have used the flashlight a time or two and am pleasantly surprised at how well it works to find friend's lost keys.
customer_reviews.author: Terzula

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting this for a while and finally picked it up. It appears well-built with decent features. It receives my local National Weather Service just fine. I gave it a full charge and turned it on to check battery life. Been running about 5 hours and still going strong. I want to drain the battery and then check the crank feature. All in all, seems like a pretty good little radio with compact size. It doesn't have the best audio quality but very good for what it's going to be used for in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KAITO Rocks the house!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We lost power for a couple of days, and a friend let us use his kaito ka500, Loved it so much bought one for us. Couple of minutes of cranking per day and it stayed juiced up ready to go day and night. Dials are far enough apart for my short fat fingers to spin, same for the crank & front dials, I like the multiple ways to charge the radio, all in all seems well built. I will post another review in a few months after I use it hiking the AT.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kellie

customer_reviews.title: tiny fragile plastic bits.
customer_reviews.text: Ever get a cheap piece of electronic brittle plastic toy with tiny brittle knobs? Yes, that's what this is. Bought as an emergency disaster box supply. I can't say for sure how long it would hold up under use, but 56 years experience with electronics tells Me not long. The dials and labels are tiny (hope you have a magnifying glass on hand during your emergency) and the entire product is very brittle / cheap plastic. We'll keep it in the box and hope we never need it.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwolfe

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME RADIO
customer_reviews.text: Company shipped it fast. Received it and with out the antenna being extended we were able to receive the weather band. Lights are bright. One plus is there is a larger light under the solar panel that can be used for reading or a bathroom light during power outages. We live in a Hurricane strike zone and are glad we purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Troy A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: This Emergency Radio is the best.
customer_reviews.text: Great emergency radio. Solar, AC, DC, Crank, Has a rechargeable battery pack (easily replaceable), and only 1 minute of cranking to charge and also takes 3 AA Batteries. AC cord and Antenna extension are inexpensive and a great addition to your KAITO EMERGENCY RADIO. Forgot to tell you about the cellphone charger, flashlight and reading light as well as as an SOS signal. It fits nicely in your backpack or camping equipment. The NOAA WEATHER ALERT works great. The AM/FM and Short Wave bands are easy to tune. The charging crank seems to be sturdy. Instructions are easy to read and understand.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Ann Campoy

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping and it performed adequately on our last trip. It’s smaller than I expected though, and the switches are a bit difficult to manipulate. Haven’t really used the crank yet, so can’t speak to that, but the solar charger seems to work ok. All in all a fairly good little radio.
customer_reviews.author: Pixleyguy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Light Weight Radio
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio in case of a disaster and so glad I choose this Katio Radio. First, the radio came neatly packaged with easy to view and read instructions. Then after plugging in the battery, the radio came in right away. I was able to get the weather, news and a lot of stations that came in clear. The other great feature, the radio is lightweight and only 5 x 8. I would highly recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed and lots of features
customer_reviews.text: This radio has a lot of good uses, especially handy for emergency situations. Sound quality depends on your location, of course, but it seems to have good reception in general. I picked up a few short-wave channels, though that's not what I bought it for. The weather warning features are good to have here in hurricane country (FL). Haven't had it long but it seems well-designed and constructed, built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Dale C.

customer_reviews.title: pREPARED FOR A POWER OUT eMERGENCY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Emergency Radio in late December and am very pleased with it's performance. I can receive 2 weather stations with very good quality and all other stations seemed to have the same good quality. I was also very pleased with the handy size of the radio and it's overall quality. I have tried to check all the functions and they work as described. I am not sure of battery life but gave it 5 stars based on my other tests. I feel I made a good purchase and will be happy if I never need it in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: DIGGER

customer_reviews.title: Good - But Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The product does what is intended. You have radio, emergency weather, led light etc. It’s just the overall quality is lacking for this price point. You can see the internal workings through gaps and it feels like one good drop and it would fall apart. The only reason I bought this one was because I thought it might have been put together a little better than the cheaper options but I would just save your money and go with one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electrical power source is not included with radio (they even say it isn't). Not good sales tech.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the product itself, sound is clear and good quality. turning knobs is easily done and feels sturdy enough that it won't break the first time you use it. My only concern is the company selling separately the electrical power source for the radio. Some times you NEED that source to do a fast recharge of the radio and you can't do that if it isn't included with the radio. Having to buy it separately is a little cheap. It may even save a life.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R

customer_reviews.title: if you are hearing impaired at all this is difficult to hear.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it can run on just about anything including SOLAR AND WIND UP GEN. but they really missed the boat using such cheap poor quality speakers, if you were in the middle of a storm with good hearing you could NOT hear this radio! I would recommend it only to those with exceptional hearing, and the features are good, you can run it off your computer, batteries, solar power, crank power and your cars charging port. and 120 volt house current.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Anne M. Otterstrom

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little solar AM/FM/Shortwave radio
customer_reviews.text: It's a good little solar radio. Instructions were a little confusing on which setting for solar but figured it out. Like most people said, it would be great with a 360 degree antenna. It's light weight for taking hiking/packing which is why I bought it and thought the short wave would be good in case of emergency. I've had it over a month now and use it on weekend on the patio with no problems or flaws. I bought the dial instead of the digital because it cost less if I broke it and I thought there would be less to go wrong with the dial. I also bought the yellow color to stand out in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Bigriver

customer_reviews.title: Decent choice for emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are that this radio is well-designed and has decent build quality and sound output. I like that there are multiple methods to power it including AA batteries. I haven't yet done extensive testing nor tried to charge my phone with the device. I think I'll take it on my next camping trip and see how it does - will update review then if anything notable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G.

customer_reviews.title: For the Price Point - Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: Like: Ease of use, radio frequency, SW, and emergency weather notifications are clear, the ports for charging are convenient and work. The crank turns easily, though I can't attest to its charging capabilities since I didn't have the time to fully explore. It takes AA batteries. There is a solar window, and because there is not much sun in the north east I didn't event attempt. Not so much: The flashlight, reading light and blinking red emergency light could be stronger. Overall a solid device and I ordered a second one since its so portable.
customer_reviews.author: Tessie

customer_reviews.title: Performance 5 stars; Design 4
customer_reviews.text: My previous radio was a silver Sony. It was about 3x5 and lasted a few years until the antenna broke after it was dropped more than once. This Kaito model needs a larger font for it's various information. The plastic is a little tacky, but I would recommend it for use, sound and portability. Re charge and other features are nice. A little pricey as listed, but I got mine used/like new from their warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: L Cheek

customer_reviews.title: mixed feeling about this radio
customer_reviews.text: purchased radio to go into a disaster prep kit. radio works well enough. my concern is while the back up power options "function" they're clunking at best. granted in a disaster I'd be more motivated to crank that handle a million times if needed but out of the box it all seems mediocre at best...
customer_reviews.author: G$Farmer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of options, multifunctional!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific NOAA radio. With all of the recent hurricanes in Florida, I decided it was time to have an emergency radio on hand. It is very good quality, can be powered by solar, crank, AC adapter, and batteries. You can’t ask for more than that! It sounds good, has an antenna, flashlight, reading light and red SOS light. Now if we lose power and cell towers, we will have the radio. Oh yeah, it ALSO has ports where you can charge your cell or other gadgets. I’ve been listening to music and weather reports for a couple of hours with AC adapter I had on hand.
customer_reviews.author: *Rock Star*Top Contributor: Painting

customer_reviews.title: Thanks it broke and I’m in the middle of a hurricane!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s broken after turning it one once and I have a hurricane warning!!!! I am so angry right now I could scream- thanks for leaving us in danger!!! Don’t buy this piece of crap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Biohacker extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: Boooooo
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed to learn during our first power outage at our house, that this won't charge a phone. That was one of the big reasons I bought this. Now it's just an overpriced radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: We didn't have a weather radio when Irma went through, so we wanted to be prepared for this hurricane season. This seems like a nice radio for the price. It has a lot of bells and whistles that we may never need, but it's nice to know they are ready if we need them. One of the final factors that made us decide on this one was all the different ways it could be powered. The parts are all plastic, so it's not super heavy duty, but I think it will serve it's purpose for us. I was able to pick up signal no problem on a clear day, so fingers crossed it works when the weather is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio to have in case of a hurricane. It's a great size - easy to handle. I like the simplicity of the analog knobs instead of digital buttons. It is easy to tune in to local stations, AM and FM, and the weather band also works well. Got a few Spanish stations on SW. The sound from the speakers is really good for its size. Flashlight and reading light are both very functional. Can't speak to battery life yet, but with multiple ways to power it, I think we're all set for the next emergency. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Martha P.

customer_reviews.title: I haven't experienced the problems that others are describing, ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't experienced the problems that others are describing, but this fills my needs in hurricane country on the Texas Gulf Coast. Light and compact, it is going into my 72-hr emergency kit. The shortwave is a bit difficult to understand but the manufacturer allegedly has an auxiliary shortwave antenna. The hand crank seems to work well, and the LED light is bright enough to read by. My local NOAA weather comes in loud and clear. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Mosley

customer_reviews.title: KA500 power outage radio, light and charger.
customer_reviews.text: Folks: I would just like to say I’m very impressed with the KA500 radio! I would also like to say that I think insurance company’s should probably pay for these life saving radios in a power outage too all seniors 65+. They rarely think about this stuff until the power does go off. Everything you need is at your fingertips except a blanket and cell phone and it even charges you cell phone. Congratulations on a fine and probably life saving device.👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I now live full-time in Hawaii where the risk of a hurricane is moderate, but the impact of a major storm would be severe. I recently purchased the KA500 and so far I am thoroughly impressed. You cannot beat the five-way power/charging system. Reception on the frequencies I tried was very good. The ability to charge cell phones and computers is a big plus. For the of quality and features found in this product the price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Pulls In Distant Signals
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit with the hopes it would be able to pull in signals of faint AM broadcasts from another state, and sure enough, it delivered! Charges reasonably quick with wind up generator and the AM radio lasts at least an hour on a 1 minute wind up session at low volume. Cannot speak to the solar panel charge rate, although I store this unit in a window without direct sunlight thinking it helps maintain somewhat of the charge(?) Extremely compact & portable, great for travel and recreation.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item but it turned up too late for me to take away. I finally got my refund but here is the caution = Kaito will charge you $13 plus tax for a return fee. Outrageous if you ask me. So whilst the unit is a nice, compact operation I don't know how long it would take for the sun to power the 3V rechargeable battery. I liked most features but the better unit to buy (I won't be buying from Kaito again) is the Kaito 500 which have a digital frequency and memory functions instead of the manual dial.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Holden

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit after the one that I paid half as much for didn't work right out of the box. This unit is well packaged, has clear operating instructions, and works great. The battery was even charged so I could verify all of the functions right away. I liked the blue color because I thought it would be easy to find in case of emergency. Overall feels well made, the switch stops line up with the switch labeling so no guessing which mode or function you're in. I would buy this radio again.
customer_reviews.author: jax_jeff

product_meta.title: Kaito KA500 5-way Powered Solar Power,Dynamo Crank, Wind Up Emergency AM/FM/SW/NOAA Weather Alert Radio with Flashlight,Reading Lamp and Cellphone Charger, Yellow
feature_bullets: 6-way powered portable emergency radio with hand crank generator, solar panel, compartment for 3 AA batteries (not included), 5V USB input, 5V AC/DC input with a wall power adapter (sold separately), built-in NiMH replaceable and rechargeable battery pack

Comprehensive coverage of AM, FM, 2-band shortwave and 7 pre-programmed NOAA weather channels for entertainment, sports, talk-shows, breaking news around the world, and 24/7 real-time weather forecast (USA and Canada ONLY) with PEAS (Public Emergency Alert System)

Works as an emergency mobile battery charger with built-in standard DC 5V USB output port for charging mobile devices, such as smart phones, GPS units, MP3 players, digital cameras, and etc. Other features include a 5-LED reading lamp, LED flashlight and a red LED S.O.S. beacon light

Telescopic antenna extends up to 14.5" for high sensitivity reception assisted by advanced semiconductor circuitry design and LED signal strength indicator for pin-point tuning accuracy, and built-in speaker delivers loud and crispy sound
Made of strong premium impact-resistant and water-resistant ABS material, suitable for both indoors home/office use and outdoors recreational activities

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,059 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
